sagex.phoenix.metadata

Class MetadataUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sagex.phoenix.metadata.MetadataUtil

  • public class MetadataUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    SageTV Metadata Class. This class should always contain the complete list of metadata fields that work with MediaFileAPI.GetMediaFileMetadata()

    Other classes can call addProperties() to register thier own custom metadata fields

      • createMetadata

        public static IMetadata createMetadata(java.lang.Object sageMediaFile)
        creates a metadata object that is backed by the Sage MediaFile. All sets/gets on the metadata are immediately reflected on the Sage MediaFile.
        Parameters:
        sageMediaFile -
        Returns:

      • createMetadata

        public static IMetadata createMetadata()
        Creates a IMetadata object that is backed by a Map. It is not persistent in any way.

        Creates a metadata object that is backed by the given map. All sets/gets to the metadata are immediately reflected in the map.

        Returns:

        Copy all metadata from the source object to the destination object, overwriting ALL metadata.
        Parameters:
        src -
        dest -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • copyModifiedMetadata

        public static void copyModifiedMetadata(IMetadata src,
                                        IMetadata dest)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Copy all metadata from the source object to the destination object, and only overwrite the destination if the source has been modified. This is useful when you modify some metadata from a source and you want to ONLY copy those modified fields to another metadata object. In addition to setting only modified values, it will NOT call set on the destination if the src and destination values are the same.
        Parameters:
        src -
        dest -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getSageProperty

        public static SageProperty getSageProperty(java.lang.String key)

      • mergeMetadata

        public static void mergeMetadata(IMetadata src,
                                 IMetadata dest)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Copies all metadata from the source to the destination, but it will not overwrite the destination if the source has null or 0 values.
        Parameters:
        src -
        dest -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • fillMetadata

        public static void fillMetadata(IMetadata src,
                                IMetadata dest)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Fills the metadata in Dest where the Dest is null and the source is not null. This has the effect of updating dest from the the src, ONLY when the dest has an empty metadata field. It does not copy from src to dest if dest has a value already.
        Parameters:
        src -
        dest -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • batchUpdate

        public static void batchUpdate(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> props,
                               IMetadata md)
        Batch update the Metadata using the Map of properties and values.

        NOTE: If you ware updating the Genre fields you can use +Genre or -Genre to add/remove a genre instead of replacing the entire genre field.

        Parameters:
        props -
        md -

      • setProperty

        public static void setProperty(IMetadata md,
                               java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String value)
        Not a very efficient way to update metadata, but can be used in cases where you can't use the typesafe methods of IMetadata. It is recommended to use this method any time you will use IMetadata .set() since this method will correct some values.
        Parameters:
        md - IMetadata instance
        key - Metadata Key
        value - Metadata Value

      • getProperty

        public static java.lang.String getProperty(IMetadata md,
                                           java.lang.String key)
        Returns a metadata field from the IMetadata object. It is recommended to use this method when calling IMetadata.get() since this method will correct some values.
        Parameters:
        md -
        key -
        Returns:
